etymonline: from com- "together" (see com-) + tenere "to hold" (see tenet)

emeaning: a standard model, or pattern regarded as typical

etymonline: from pp. stem of noscere "come to know" (see know)
from L. com- "with" (see com-) + temporarius "of time,"
from ob "over" (see ob-) + servare "to watch, keep safe" from PIE root *ser- "to protect" => keep watching / serv- keep / conserve
emeaning:
1. paying close attentions
2. diligent in obseving a law
cmeaning:
adj. 警惕的, 警觉的
adj. 严格遵守(规章、制度或原则)的
